students.name: Sulaiman Allen
students.bio: Sulaiman Allen grew up in Nashville with a passion for technology. After years of pursuing computer science as a hobby, Sule is excited to turn that interest into a full time profession.

students.name: Amari Ashwood
students.bio: Amari has always been very passionate about technology and the possibilities to improve everyone's day to day life. Programming has been her way of getting hands-on experience in implementing her ideas.

students.name: Melanie Baker
students.bio: Raised in Pennsylvania and with a background in banking, I left it all behind to follow my dream of becoming a web developer in Nashville. When I am not coding, you can find me traveling the world and taking pictures!

students.name: Keith Bradley
students.bio: Keith Bradley is a Python and Javascript developer with a passion for creating new things and improving existing systems. His experience in management and technical design inform his methods for software development. Keith also enjoys planning fiction stories and urban exploring when he's not coding.

students.name: Castle Crawford
students.bio: Castle Crawford invented databasing. An AngularJS and golf aficionado, Castle will add value to your group with by sending his legions of mice to chew on the cables at competing dev shops. Like Samson, his hair is his might.

students.name: Danielle Duer
students.bio: Danielle Duer, a native Nashvillian, is a professional designer devoted to creating compelling imagery that tells a story. Her passion for design has been evident all through her career. Now, by gaining the skills to work with powerful programming languages, she is wild about giving life to more interactive experiences.

students.name: Mark Easterling
students.bio: Mark is a former clinical scientist with a proclivity for technology and music. He is avidly transitioning to a career in software development.

students.name: Alan Eatherly
students.bio: Born and raised in Nashville, Alan Eatherly has long been passionate about cutting-edge technology, healthcare, and sports. He is looking forward to utilizing those passions while growing as a developer.

students.name: Megan Ford
students.bio: Megan Ford's background is in project management, time management, people management, and cosplay- all of which have proven greatly useful in learning to program. Her best friend is Trello, her favorite pastime is organizing data into functional structures, and she brings energy, enthusiasm, and a self-starting attitude to her team and community.

students.name: John Green
students.bio: John has always enjoyed helping others improve their quality of life. This desire, along with his curiosity and passion for technology is what gave him the drive to become a software developer. His ultimate goal is to use those skills to create something that can be useful in people's everyday lives.

students.name: Hannah Hall
students.bio: Hannah moved to Nashville in 2009 to attend Belmont. She graduated in 2013 with a degree in Music Business. However, she has always had an interest in web development. Hannah is eager to combine both of her passions after graduating NSS.

students.name: Tekisha Hammock
students.bio: Tekisha Hammock once successfully wielded her family heirloom Spiked Club of the Whale to decimate a cadre of low-rent anime-dubbing voice actors. For her efforts, she received the Victoria Cross. â€˜Kisha likewise aims for purity in her code. Who hires her will earn her pledge of loyalty along with her sword arm. Precision and timeliness are her hallmarks.

students.name: Carter Harris
students.bio: After four years of touring in the lighting production world, Carter Harris took his problem solving skills from the concert venues to the development of web applications.

students.name: Simon Herrera
students.bio: With 20 years of experience in the tech industry, Simon Herrera can now add software development to his list of skills. His experience working in a manufacturing team environment combined with his passion for computer programming should serve him well as he integrates into the Nashville development workforce.

students.name: Patrick Howell
students.bio: Patrick Howell once weighed over 630 pounds. He learned to code during his three-year recovery from an experimental bariatric surgery that resulted in the removal of all non-essential organs. He now survives on cigarettes and compassion for devs less able than himself. Great team-player.

students.name: Joe Kane
students.bio: Following a classified encounter with an overly-amorous hydrothermal vent back in â€™06, Joe Kane retired from the Delta Force and took up whiskey-tasting. His palate is now so refined and his pheromones so potent that he writes code by literally breathing it onto the screen, which is pretty dope.

students.name: Michael Mead
students.bio: After retiring from the U.S. Army, Michael Mead chose to invest his leadership experience and dogged mental discipline into software development. He will bring an inexhaustible work ethic, eye for detail, and ability to integrate seamlessly into any team to your project.

students.name: Whitney Mitchell
students.bio: Born in Nashville, Whitney is a full-stack web developer who loves working with creative people to solve complex problems. She is excited to be entering an industry that supports/necessitates continual learning.

students.name: Adam Oswalt
students.bio: Continuing a lifelong interest in technology, Adam Oswalt is furthering his knowledge and experience as a software developer through building new things and pursing new problems to overcome.

students.name: Chase Ramsey
students.bio: Chase hails from East Tennessee, and before he was coding, his background was in writing, teaching, and research. He loves getting caught up in engaging conversations and hopes to work in an environment where those conversations inform lasting, meaningful work.

students.name: Russell Ries
students.bio: A Nashville native, Russell Ries Jr. has held many jobs. He is excited to embark on a career as a full-time developer and looks forward to combining his ever increasing ability as a programmer with his love of local history.

students.name: Damon Romano
students.bio: Still on the run from the law, Damon Romano has mastered the Vichyssoise fork in personal combat. His approach to project architecture and TDD consistently produces entire planetary defense systems that run from a single character of code. Damonâ€™s software development emerges from his unorthodox parenting style, in which a single, micro-expressive glance can often cause a small child to spontaneously achieve spiritual mastery.

students.name: Cory Tohill
students.bio: Cory James Tohill, a Goodlettsville, TN native, has long been interested in computers, cooking, and video games. He hopes to use his passion as a web developer to contribute to the development community while continuing to learn and improve his skills.

students.name: Ben Wilburn
students.bio: A strength & conditioning and little-league coach, Benâ€™s classmates rely on his ready help. His unrelenting tenacity makes him a quick learner unafraid to ask questions. He brings patience, a can-do attitude, and a mentorship ethic to every team he joins.

students.name: Jessica Wynn
students.bio: Jessica has a passion for learning! Her quest to learn is what led her to become a software developer. Whether itâ€™s sewing, playing board games, or her new venture into gardening she loves applying herself and learning new things
